text: Parsing an unknown data structure in python
I have a file containing lots of data put in a form similar to this:

code:
Group1 {  
    Entry1 {  
        Title1 [{Data1:Member1, Data2:Member2}]  
        Title2 [{Data3:Member3, Data4:Member4}]  
    }  
    Entry2 {  
        ...  
    }  
}
Group2 {
    DifferentEntry1 {
        DiffTitle1 {
            ...
        }
    }
}

text: Thing is, I don't know how many layers of parentheses there are, and how the data is structured.
I need modify the data, and delete entire 'Entry's depending on conditions involving data members before writing everything to a new file.
What's the best way of reading in a file like this?
